headline.print_headline: Company Creates Panel for Access to Trial Drugs
headline.main: Company Creates Bioethics Panel on Trial Drugs

snippet: Johnson & Johnson named the bioethicist Arthur L. Caplan to create a panel to decide on patients’ requests for lifesaving medicines before they are approved.
abstract: Giant drug maker Johnson & Johnson is tapping renowned bioethicist Arthur L Caplan to form panel to evaluate requests by critically ill patients for access to potentially lifesaving, experimental medicines prior to their approval; issue is fraught with emotion and raises basic ethical questions about fairness and equal access to care; move by Johnson & Johnson could prompt other drug makers to follow suit.
